content.raw: `EXTENT_NULL` is correct for the default constructor, and `EXTENT_FINITE` is correct for constructors that accept box parameters. Just made the change to correct this pull request.
content.html: EXTENT_NULL is correct for the default constructor, and EXTENT_FINITE is correct for constructors that accept box parameters. Just made the change to correct this pull request.

content.raw: Sorry, I think I made my earlier comment about this file without fully understanding the code. I'm not exactly sure how the extent variables are used. @nkoenig should this value be set to `EXTENT_NULL` only in the default constructor? I don't see any places where the extent variable is modified based on an explicit check of the min and max variables.
content.html: Sorry, I think I made my earlier comment about this file without fully understanding the code. I'm not exactly sure how the extent variables are used. @nkoenig should this value be set to EXTENT_NULL only in the default constructor? I don't see any places where the extent variable is modified based on an explicit check of the min and max variables.

update.title: Fix Coverity issues

content.raw: One may want to call Camera::SetClipDist(float _near, float _far) which will later call WideAngleCamera::SetClipDist(). If that is not the intended behaviour, then SetClipDist(float _near, float _far) should be implemented in WideAngleCamera.
content.html: One may want to call Camera::SetClipDist(float _near, float _far) which will later call WideAngleCamera::SetClipDist(). If that is not the intended behaviour, then SetClipDist(float _near, float _far) should be implemented in WideAngleCamera.

content.raw:
There was a discussion on the same issue in ign-math: https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/pull-requests/94/fix-coverity-issues/activity#comment-14879669
A copy constructor could be added in each derived class for consistency.
content.html: There was a discussion on the same issue in ign-math: https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/pull-requests/94/fix-coverity-issues/activity#comment-14879669 A copy constructor could be added in each derived class for consistency.

content.raw: It isn't really using it though...
content.html: It isn't really using it though...

content.raw: What is the reason for adding a copy constructor here? The `ShortName` getter for example is implemented in each derived class, so the copied object wouldn't have it.
content.html: What is the reason for adding a copy constructor here? The ShortName getter for example is implemented in each derived class, so the copied object wouldn't have it.

content.raw: This is now ready for review.
content.html: This is now ready for review.

content.raw: I guess this fixes some of not initialized memory errors that were reported by running the tests under Valgrind using the `GAZEBO_RUN_VALGRIND_TESTS` option, great!
content.html: I guess this fixes some of not initialized memory errors that were reported by running the tests under Valgrind using the GAZEBO_RUN_VALGRIND_TESTS option, great!

content.raw: To avoid leaks it should also be necessary to free the memory allocated by `strdup`, as in https://bitbucket.org/ocrave/gazebo/src/0e64cd9554dac600878faf082f3cb7866f93f12c/gazebo/test/ServerFixture.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#ServerFixture.cc-278 ?
content.html: To avoid leaks it should also be necessary to free the memory allocated by strdup, as in https://bitbucket.org/ocrave/gazebo/src/0e64cd9554dac600878faf082f3cb7866f93f12c/gazebo/test/ServerFixture.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#ServerFixture.cc-278 ?

content.raw: Given that Gazebo now uses C++11, perhaps it is better to explicitly `= delete` this methods?
content.html: Given that Gazebo now uses C++11, perhaps it is better to explicitly = delete this methods?
